I'm sure that it was difficult working with a lazy alcoholic like Ace, BUT:

Bob Ezrin was the wrong guy for KISS, Kramer always got a better 'real 
KISS' sound. 'Destroyer' worked because of the songs, but had a sound that 
was too slick and over-produced. 'Music from the Elder' was one of the 
worst pieces of crap of all-time. The studio songs on 'Alive II' weren't 
very good. In all 3 cases, and probably many more, Ace was having a bad 
reaction to a bad process; he couldn't explain it verbally, but he had a 
good musician's gut reaction that Gene and Paul should have respected 
instead of insisting that the plan was a good one and that all that was 
needed to make it work was to get Ace's compliance.

AND:

Ace came up with the original KISS logo, perhaps the most easily recognized 
in Rock. The most memorable part of 'Alive II' was Ace's solo on 'Shock 
Me'. Ace's KISS/solo record was the best of the 4 by a long shot, and 
Gene's was ridiculously bad. And Gene got lazy himself between 'Animalize' 
and 'Revenge': the only halfway decent songs from that period were written 
by Paul. And Ace seems to have been the only in the band that understood 
what "farewell tour" means.﻿

Let’s look at the sins for which mankind will have to answer for.
Not loving God but instead placing ourselves before Him in priority.
Shaping a god in our minds that we are comfortable with.
Taking His name in vain. His name defines who He is, that is why this is a 
sin.
The days He gives to us are a gift, yet we fail to give thanks for them.
Disobeying and dishonoring our parents.
Jesus said that hating someone is the same as murder. This is because God 
judges the intention of our hearts.
The same goes for lust. Having pornographic sexual thoughts about someone 
is adultery of the heart.
Ever stolen? Anything? Value is irrelevant; God judges the intention of the 
heart, not the value of the object stolen.
How many lies have you told?
You shall not covet. Desiring things and valuing them over God, esteeming 
things over our fellow man, this is coveting and who among us is not guilty 
of this?
The finite crimes that man commits against an infinite God will be punished 
for eternity because God is eternal. We know this is true and can see it 
every day in our civil courts. If a man rapes a woman and it only lasts for 
an hour, the man is not punished for an hour and then released. That would 
be ludicrous. We know the judge will sentence him to years in prison for 
the crime.
If a man lies to a child, nothing happens to the man, the child has no 
authority over the man. If a man lies to his wife, he will be sleeping on 
the couch. If a man lies to his boss, he will be fired. If a man lies to 
the government, he will be put in prison for treason. The man commits the 
same crime to a different person each time in this scenario. The thing that 
changes is the authority of the person to whom the crime offends. God is 
the highest authority over mankind and He is the one to whom lies are most 
offensive. Revelation 21:8 “…all liars, their portion will be in the lake 
that burns with fire and sulfur, which is the second death.”
Our crimes against God are not merely a few either. Think of this; if you 
sin just three times a day for a year, at the end of the year you have 
1,095 sins to answer for. After 20 years the number of sins jumps to 
21,900. We tend to think of sin as no big deal, but we sin more than three 
times a day and the number of sins we must answer for is astronomical.
God loves you and does not want to send you to hell, but you deserve 
punishment for your sins. That is why Jesus voluntarily took your 
punishment for you on the cross. Jesus is God in human flesh, that is why 
the Father accepts the payment Jesus made. Because Jesus is eternal and you 
have offended an eternal God, the payment Jesus makes is satisfactory to 
the Father.
Jesus Christ suffered and died in your place for your sins. Jesus, the 
sinless Lamb of God, took upon Himself your sin and shame at the cross; and 
that is where the Father punished Jesus for your sins. That is the kindest 
thing God has done for us. God is right to destroy us all right now, but 
His love for us is what is stopping the ax from falling. One day the ax 
will fall and if you have not been forgiven by God through Jesus’ death 
burial, and resurrection then the ax will fall on you. I don’t want that to 
happen to you.
 
I really hope you think about this. We are all faced with the same choice. 
Repent and trust in Jesus for the forgiveness of our sins; or die in our 
sins and be condemned.﻿

KISS was very cool... until about 1977. After that everything was about 
merchandizing. Their audience was primarily teenagers up to about thirty 
years old in the beginning but quickly became a very child orientated 
venture...comic books, stickers, toys, cartoons etc... Even the album Love 
Gun came with a paper gun that when flung with your wrist had a pop-out 
paper fold that said "Bang"! That's the epitome of childish. In reality 
KISS had a very short musical career. About five years. The rest was just 
riding the wave. Simmons and Stanley were good R&R writers but they never 
progressed musically. Album after album of the same thing...it got boring. 
So five years of cool Rock and Roll and then seemingly endless years of 
marketing. Even their makeup reunion had a stench of phony Beatlemania.
It's hard to believe that Simmons is still griping about Frehley's 
anti-social drug problems some 30+ years later. It's so boring. Gene 
Simmons is boring. I say "move on". The rest of us have. KISS is over. It's 
not even good R&R history thanks to Gene. They could have remained a legend 
if they had just quit while they were ahead but Simmon's strung it out 
decade after decade until there was absolutely nothing left. Nothing but 
YouTube gripes and very little original footage from when KISS was very 
cool.﻿

Gene is easy to dislike.  I don't dispute this.  I just saw them in July of 
2014 after a hiatus of 18 years.  I last saw them at the Forum in Aug of 
1996.  The current show was great, really great.  I think it's easy for 
fans like me who think, both then and now, Paul and Gene were the most 
interesting characters.  None of this information should be surprising.  
Look at how ugly divorces get.  I think that most of the info Gene is 
communicating here is true.  Ace and Peter were raw talents.  Perhaps too 
raw. Peter and Ace owed Paul and Gene a larger share of any reunion 
activities because Paul and Gene kept the arena shows going through the 80s 
and 90s.  Have no illusions, those shows were just as exciting to anyone 
who attended as the classic seventies shows.  That is worth a lot in terms 
of building in value for KISS, and it was hard work for P, G, B and E.  The 
car crash and gun stories concerning Ace and Peter should be enough for 
anyone to draw a simple conclusion.  Ace and Peter were really immature and 
were reckless.  Paul and Gene, now in advanced ages, cannot put up with 
this...  and neither would any of us who are educated and older than 35.  
I'm comfortable with never having the original 4 together again (would you 
want to be around someone you really didn't like?) and KISS in its current 
form only has a few years more.  See them if you can on this tour.  It's 
great, even if Paul's voice is hit or miss. ﻿

While I don't think Gene Simmons is the greatest thing on earth, you can't 
deny he's outstanding when it comes to business and I don't believe it has 
anything to do with him being of Jewish decent. KISS was a business for 
him. It was a way for him to make money and get women. Paul seemed to be of 
the same way of thinking. When you've got two on and two off, you're in 
danger of the business going bust. Yes, they were all friends, but when you 
do business with friends you run the risk of losing that friendship and 
becoming blind to what originally made you friends with that person in the 
first place. I honestly believe Gene and Paul just wanted what was best for 
the business and after it became clear Ace wasn't 100% in it, you do what 
you need to do so you aren't left on a sinking ship.

Does no one remember how badly Axl screwed over the original members of 
GnR? Yes, they all had their own demons and made their own mistakes, but I 
believe he was the biggest reason they broke up. To this day, Slash doesn't 
have any kind words for Axl and Axl refuses to play with the rest of them 
for any reason. Again, another example of why going into business with 
friends, especially the Rock N Roll business, isn't always the greatest 
idea. When drugs, alcohol and sex are thrown in the mix it usually ends up 
less than pleasant.

As for drudging up the past; there are always going to be fans that are 
curious as to what happened behind the scenes. This was Gene's take on it. 
While it may not be the complete truth, this is how he saw things go down. 
People can choose to believe it if they want or they can write it off. ﻿
